isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - INSTRUMENT PANEL (BEFORE DECEMBER 5, 1994)

svcprocinfo.para: Removable instrument panel sections provide for easy access to speedometer, cables, gauges, bulbs, wiring, plumbing, switches, valves, etc. For further information on the instrument panel, refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

important.para: Always disconnect battery ground before servicing or removing instrument panel cover.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 12for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove ashtray (Item 5). Remove ashtray housing screws and pull housing (Item 6) clear of panel.
Remove screws (Item 9) from the front of the left side cover (Item 7).
Remove cover by detaching dual lock fasteners (Item 3) using a screwdriver to pry the pieces apart. Use caution not to crack or break the plastic lock tab.
Remove right side cover (Item 4) by removing screws (Item 9) and prying apart dual lock fasteners (Item 3).

note.para: To remove instrument panel frame, remove cover and gauges as described in above procedures. Then remove screws retaining instrument panel frame to cowl (bulk head).

svcsubproc.title: Install

important.para: Always disconnect battery ground before servicing or installing instrument panel cover.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 12for Items in parentheses.

note.para: To install instrument panel frame, place frame in position and secure with screws to cowl (bulk head). Then install cover and gauges as described in the following procedures.

step1.para: Position right side cover (Item 4) and attach with screws (Item 9). Do not tighten.
Position left side cover (Item 7) and attach with screws (Item 9). Do not tighten.
Attach the dual lock fasteners (Item 3) together by striking the cover at the fastener locations with the edge of the hand. There are seven fastener locations.
Position ashtray housing (Item 6) in place and attach with screws. Insert ashtray (Item 5).
